column4: How can I find out whether Ubuntu recognized my TV card or not? I just installed it.
sudo lshw
! hardware | phillipblack
http://pastebin.ca/1530732 I am not sure. Is my pinnacle card in there?
let me take a look.
I see a nvidia  G7600?
that is my video card.
I have a pinnacle tv card in there also. Just installed it.
n2I have a pinnacle tv card in there also. Just installed it.
I have a pinnacle tv card in there also. Just installed it.
do you have a make and model for the pinnacle?
unfortunately not. I thought I could find it out via some command. I didn't use the TV card for a long time and threw the box away. I don't recall what model it is.
ok, I didn't see anything about pinnacle, but it could be listed by make and model? You can get that off the card from the FCC ID#, and google.
I will have a look. Thx for your help.
GL
there is no such thing on the card. There is only a sticker with a barcode some long number just underneath it Pinnacle systems GmbH and some other long number followed by (h)
I have a /dev/video0 so that means that it was recognized, right?
at least that is what it says in the wiki I am just looking at.
What program can I use to record TV with my TV card?
xawtv ?
I have a picture it works! xawtv works! *happy* But I don't have a sound. :(
